metadata.title: CVE-2014-3192 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the ProcessingInstruction::setXSLStyleSheetfunction in core/dom/ProcessingInstruction.cpp in the DOM implementation inBlink, as used in Google Chrome before 38.0.2125.101, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-browser-l10n - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-chromedriver - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.2.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.2.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.2.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.2.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.2.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
